 I'm hardly an authority on the subject, but I believe definitions to go something along the lines of:
 
 Paganism- Refers to a variety of religions of non-christian/jewish origins. Mostly pre-christian as well.
 
 Neo-Paganism- As Paganism, but a term used by some to describe Pagan religions in a modern context.
 
 Wicca- A Pagan religion founded in the 50s. Incorporates mainly pre-christian beliefs. Largely polytheistic but can vary. Generally incorporates magic use. Probably the best known Pagan religion.
 
 Satanism- A reactionary religion against Christianity. Incorporating both Pagan and Christian aspects. Takes Satan as a symbolic figurehead, not a literal deity. Some incorporate involvement in magic and witchcraft.
 
 Devil worship- The literal worship of Satan. Not really an organised religion. Mostly exists in rebellious kids, christian scare-stories and the mentally unbalanced. Could incorporate almost anything!
 
 Witchcraft- Not a religion, the use of magic in various contexts.
